member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonObject.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts current IJSonObject into a string using formatting. Currently supported formats are: - 'null' value - for using ToString() call - 'i' - to force indented output - 'n' - to disable indented output, but leave spaces after array item separators and between object name and value - 'c' - to disable indented output and compact content as much as possible

member.name: T:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReaderNumberFormat
member.summary: Enumeration defining, what data type should be used, to hold information about numbers. This can have an mostly on rounding and some impact on memory footprint. However, when a given format is forced, and the value number can't be parsed to fit into that format, the whole JSON parsing will faild with an exception (i.e. forcing AsInt32 and receiving decimal value).

member.name: F:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReaderNumberFormat.Default
member.summary: Default behaviour. If number can be stored as Int64 or UInt64, this type is used, otherwise Double.

member.name: F:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReaderNumberFormat.AsInt32
member.summary: Force all numeric values parsed to be an Int32.

member.name: F:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReaderNumberFormat.AsInt64
member.summary: Force all numeric values parsed to be an Int64.

member.name: F:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReaderNumberFormat.AsDouble
member.summary: Force all numeric values to be Double.

member.name: F:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReaderNumberFormat.AsDecimal
member.summary: Force all numeric values to be Decimal.
